chargeHist.descr: Operating a Motor Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick M. L. Lane was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CF442 and any current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

ADDRESS INFO for Patrick M. L. Lane
Current: 1730 W. Snell Rd, Oshkosh Correctional, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 601 Superior St, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729
Mailed to Defendant at Oshkosh Correctional per his request.

Cases called at 9:55 AM: 22CF442, 22CF461, 22CM150, 22CT28.
Defendant Patrick M. L. Lane appeared by video, in custody from Oshkosh Correctional. Attorney David Field appeared in court for Patrick M.L. Lane. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CM105: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3 and Count 5 as charged. Court sentences the Defendant to Court Costs/surcharges, DNA Sample/surcharge. Restitution TBD and collected by DOC.
22CF442: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Drive or Operate a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent; PTAC; Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
22CF461: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Drive or Operate a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent; Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
Defendant is sentenced to 3 Years of Initial Confinement followed by 3 Years of Extended Supervision with the following conditions:
Restitution TBD and collected by DOC. Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant is granted 3 days of sentence credit in 22CF461. 
.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on October 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF442 & 22CF461.

(Case called at 11:30 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Patrick Lane appears in custody via video conference from the Chippewa County Jail without counsel. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives reading of the complaint. State requests $3,000 cash bond in 22CF442 cover 22CF461 with additional conditions. Defendant requests signature bond. Court orders $3,000 cash bond in 22CF442 cover 22CF461 with additional conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing is waived.
